poem:
Title: Appointments at Dawn

In the rustling morning paper,
a name emerges, Jason Tarry-
seasoned in the aisles of commercial cues.

John Lewis's veins pulse with new promise,
A "big move" through shared moonlight,
A coronation in headlines, neat and gray.

Sharon White takes her bow 
in the September rust, 
Change unfurls like priced tags 
in the departments of progress.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "John Lewis Partnership appoints ex-Tesco exec Jason Tarry as next chair – business live 9.50am BST 9.43am BST Hiring Jason Tarry is a “big move” to quash the constant criticism about the lack of retail expertise at the top of John Lewis, says The Sun’s Ashley Armstrong: Big news from John Lewis Partnership this morning as Tesco veteran Jason Tarry appointed as new chairman.Sharon White to now leave in September. Hire is a big move". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: John Lewis Partnership appoints ex-Tesco exec Jason Tarry as next chair – business live 9.50am BST 9.43am BST Hiring Jason Tarry is a “big move” to quash the constant criticism about the lack of retail expertise at the top of John Lewis, says The Sun’s Ashley Armstrong: Big news from John Lewis Partnership this morning as Tesco veteran Jason Tarry appointed as new chairman.Sharon White to now leave in September. Hire is a big move
